events.title: Publication of the Communist Manifesto
events.description: Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels publish the Communist Manifesto, outlining the principles of communism and socialism.
events.significance: This document became a foundational text for socialist and communist movements worldwide, influencing political ideologies and revolutions.

events.title: Assassination of Malcolm X
events.description: African-American civil rights leader Malcolm X was assassinated while preparing to address the Organization of Afro-American Unity in New York City.
events.significance: Malcolm X's death marked a significant moment in the civil rights movement, highlighting tensions and the struggle for racial equality in the United States.

events.title: Christian Dior's New Look Unveiled
events.description: Christian Dior presented his first fashion collection in Paris, introducing the 'New Look' which revolutionized women's fashion after World War II.
events.significance: The 'New Look' influenced fashion globally, emphasizing femininity and luxury during the post-war recovery period.

events.title: Battle of Verdun Begins
events.description: One of the longest and most brutal battles of World War I, the Battle of Verdun between French and German forces, started in France.
events.significance: The battle symbolized French determination and endurance, becoming a turning point in the war's Western Front.

events.title: Start of the U.S.-China Ping Pong Diplomacy
events.description: The U.S. table tennis team was invited to visit China, marking the beginning of improved U.S.-China relations during the Cold War.
events.significance: Ping Pong Diplomacy paved the way for President Nixon's visit to China and a significant thaw in Sino-American relations.
